caption.p: Observed and simulated time series of the anomalies in annual and global mean surface temperature. All anomalies are differences from the 1961 to 1990 time-mean of each individual time series. The reference period 1961–1990 is indicated by yellow shading; vertical dashed grey lines represent times of major volcanic eruptions. ( a) Single simulations for CMIP5 models (thin lines); multi-model mean (thick red line); different observations (thick black lines). Inset: the global mean surface temperature for the reference period 1961–1990, for each individual model (colours), the CMIP5 multi-model mean (thick red), and the observations. ( b) Single simulations from available EMIC simulations (thin lines). Observational data are the same as in ( a). All EMIC simulations ended in 2005 and use the CMIP5 historical forcing scenario. Inset: Same as in ( a) but for the EMICs (adapted from Flato et al. [ 3]).
